creator: d4nerd@gmail.com
text:
When some file extension is set in apache2.conf by AddType:

AddType application/x-httpd-php .php

... server is also parsing filenames like .php. so it can be used in some kind
of injections like while uploading files by PHP.

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
Please RTFM, and use a user support forum to clarify any remaining questions.

What you're doing is wrong: this use of AddType was a dirty hack that became
obsolete in 1996.  What you're seeing is multiviews.
